}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *OEM: [[Askey]] RTV1645VW-E83 ([https://wk.baidu.com/view/413066b265ce05087632134b?pcf=2#32 label]) :([[Huawei]] HG65DT83 VER. E) {{see also|Huawei EchoLife HG655b}}
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Firmware=== Telekom offers a [https://www.telekom.de/hilfe/downloads/firmware-speedport-w723v-typa-v1-01-018.bin firmware file] sized 8,202,592 bytes from April 2017 ready to be dissected.
Firmware contains the strings [https://www.broadcom.com/products/broadband/xdsl/bcm6368 Broadcom BCM6368] so maybe it used the bcm6368 SoC.
[[Broadcom]] BCM6368 is also used by the [[Netgear VVG2000-1]], see also [https://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/vvg2000-1 OpenWrt wiki].
And as of March 2018 Netgear still provides some [https://kb.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2649 source code] for their device.
===Source code=== According to the [https://www.telekom.de/hilfe/downloads/bedienungsanleitung-speedport-w723v-typa.pdf User's Manual] (German language!) page 279, the firmware runs: * Linux 2.6.21.5 * µclibc no version specified * busybox 1.9.1 * sipproxd 0.5.10 * ntfs-3g 2010.1.16 * and diverse other GPLed software
The only [http://www.elbeno.com/openwrt/123-netfilter_trigger.patch patch] mentioned is named "OpenWrt" version "2.4.30" to be found at.
